stem: Given question: James and Ruth were getting a divorce.  It was amicable, but it wasn't happy.  There was a lot of what emotion? and answer: sadness, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Divorces are difficult, and even the amicable ones are sad as they signify the end of relationships.
100_to_150_words: The divorce of James and Ruth was amicable, however it was not a happy experience. This is because divorce is typically an emotionally charged period, and even if it is amicable, it can be heartbreaking for both parties. There is a lot of sadness that comes with a divorce, even if it is the best decision for both parties. The sadness is caused by the breakup of a relationship that once brought joy and companionship. The sadness is also caused by the fear of the unknown and the uncertainty of the future. There is also a feeling of loneliness and loss, of something that once gave life meaning. In addition, there can be a sense of guilt and regret, even if both parties recognize that the divorce is the best decision. All of these feelings of sadness can be overwhelming and can take time to process.
